channel.title: News on Flow Stability Research Group
channel.description: Recent content in News on Flow Stability Research Group

item.title: New paper published: analytical irregular initial condition of the Navier-Stokes equations
item.description: Our paper is published about a three-dimensional, analytic flow example that does not fulfill the compatibility condition. Therefore, the solution is irregular at the initial time.

item.title: Conference in Athens
item.description: From our research team, Dr. György Paál and Dr. Tamás Péter Nagy presented our latest research results in connection with miniature vortex generators and a new type of stability testing method at the European Fluid Mechanics Conference held in Athens.

item.title: Conference in Paris
item.description: From our research team, Dr. Tamás Péter Nagy and András Szabó presented our latest research results on the ability of miniature vortex generators and elastic coatings to delay the laminar-turbulent transition.
